"long story short: my son got home, ecstatic with independence," she wrote. long story longer, and analyzed, to boot: half the people i've told this episode to now want to turn me in for child abuse. as if keeping kids under lock and key and helmet and cell phone and nanny and surveillance is the right way to rear kids. it's not. it's debilitating-- for us and for them. after the story of the fourth-grader alone on the subway was picked up by media outlets around the world, with Lenore Skenazy alternately congratulated and vilified, she started a blog called free range kids "dedicated to sane parenting
